alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 29 at 8:35AM CDT until May 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Tyler Forks near Mellen affecting Iron and Ashland Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible on the Tyler Forks River. * WHERE...Tyler Forks River near Mellen. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.8 feet, At this level State Highway 169 is likely impacted by flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. More information on possible flooding of the Tyler Forks River can be found at www.weather.gov/dlh/spring-flooding. && &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1000 PM CDT.
